channel.title: [TUT]Changing The Default Text Color/Effect[TUT]
channel.description:
My Tutorial Number: 1
This Is My First Tutorial
Files Editing: client.java
Difficulty: 0/10
Knowledge Needed: How To Type
First open client.java and search for: [code]if(s.startsWith("dump")) {[/code]
Under that you should see: [code]} int j2 = 0; int i3 = 0;[/code]
j2 is the text colour This is the bit you edit to change the default colour
Colour Codes:
Yellow = 0 Red = 1 Green = 2 Cyan = 3 Purple = 4 White = 5 Flash1 = 6 Flash2 = 7 Flash3 = 8 Glow1 = 9 Glow2 = 10 Glow3 = 11
Now Compile
Editing Text Effects:
Again search for in client.java: [code]if(s.startsWith("dump")) {[/code]
under that you should also have [code]int i3 = 0;[/code]
Edit this to apply a default text effect:
Text Effects:
None = 0 Wave = 1 Wave2 = 2 Shake = 3 Scroll = 4 Slide = 5
Hope You Like It

item.title: [TUT]Changing The Default Text Color/Effect[TUT]
item.dc:creator: @LOLMFAO LOLMFAO
item.description:
@LOLMFAO wrote:

he’s in the client.java of his client

[quote=“Rookie, post:2, topic:225599”]This is what mine says

} if (str2.startsWith("dump")); byte b1 = 5; byte b2 = 0; if (str2.startsWith("yellow:")) { b1 = 0; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("red:")) { b1 = 1; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(4); } else if (str2.startsWith("green:")) { b1 = 2; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("cyan:")) { b1 = 3; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(5); } else if (str2.startsWith("purple:")) { b1 = 4; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("white:")) { b1 = 5; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("flash1:")) { b1 = 6; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("flash2:")) { b1 = 7; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("flash3:")) { b1 = 8; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("glow1:")) { b1 = 9; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("glow2:")) { b1 = 10; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("glow3:")) { b1 = 11; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } str2 = this.aString887.toLowerCase(); if (str2.startsWith("wave:")) { b2 = 1; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(5); } else if (str2.startsWith("wave2:")) { b2 = 2; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("shake:")) { b2 = 3; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(6); } else if (str2.startsWith("scroll:")) { b2 = 4; this.aString887 = this.aString887.substring(7); } else if (str2.startsWith("slide:"))

what do i do? thanks.[/quote]

do exactly what he told you lol where it says byte b1 = 5; byte b2 = 0; change the 5 to what text color you want (He provided a list in the guide) and change the 0 to what text effect you want such as wave scroll or slide (he provided a list in his guide) save and close then compile =D

Read full topic

@joshcool wrote:

My Tutorial Number: 1

This Is My First Tutorial

Files Editing:
client.java

Difficulty:
0/10

Knowledge Needed:
How To Type

First open client.java and search for:

if(s.startsWith("dump")) {

Under that you should see:

} int j2 = 0; int i3 = 0;

j2 is the text colour
This is the bit you edit to change the default colour

Colour Codes:

Yellow = 0
Red = 1
Green = 2
Cyan = 3
Purple = 4
White = 5
Flash1 = 6
Flash2 = 7
Flash3 = 8
Glow1 = 9
Glow2 = 10
Glow3 = 11

if(s.startsWith("dump")) {

under that you should also have

int i3 = 0;

Text Effects:

None = 0
Wave = 1
Wave2 = 2
Shake = 3
Scroll = 4
Slide = 5
